definition[0]: to dishonestly take something that someone has trusted you with, especially money or goods that belong to your employer
example[0]: He claimed the finance manager had misappropriated company funds.
definition[1]: to dishonestly take something, especially money, that you have been trusted to keep safe, and to use it for your own advantage
example[1]: He was accused of misappropriating funds amounting to Â£4 million.
example[2]: Building materials had been misappropriated for private use.
